TextView.android:text: No person, firm or corporation, including any agency or instrumentality of the government shall erect, construct, alter, repair, convert or demolish any building or structure or cause the same to be done without first obtaining a building permit therefor from the Building Official assigned in the place where the subject building is located or the building work is to be done.
All citizens, firm or corporation and government agencies.
- Detailed building plan with specification (5 sets original copy)
- Detailed cost estimates (5 sets original copy)
In case the applicant is the registered owner of the lot;
- Certified true copy of OCT/TCT (3 photocopy)
- Current real property tax receipt (3 photocopy)
In case the applicant is not the registered owner of the lot;
- Duly notarized copy of the contract of lease or sale (3 photocopy)
- Duly notarized copy of the Deed of Absolute Sale (3 photocopy)
- Fire Safety Evaluation Clearance (1 original copy)
- ECC / CNC Certificate (if applicable) (1 original copy)
- DPWH Certification for RROW (if the structure along Sayre highway)(1 original copy)
- DPWH 2nd Engineering District, Pinamaloy, Don Carlos, Bukidnon
1. Client to submit all necessary requirements
1.1. Verify the completeness of the requirements including the signatures of owner & engineers then receive the application
1.2. Endorse one set of plans, specifications & bill of materials to Municipal Fire Marshall for FSEC.
1.2.1. Fire Marshall assess the application for payment endorsed FSEC to OBO.
Fees to be computed and paid at the Fire Marshall office.
1.3. Endorse one set of plans, specifications & bill of materials to MPDO for issuance of zoning clearance.
1.3.1. MPDO assess the application and payment and endorsed to OBO.
Fees to be computed by MPDO.
1.3.2. MPDO endorsed approved Zoning Clearance to OBO.

1.4. Review plans, verify if the proposed structure conforms with the IRR of the National Building Code (PD 1096). Assess plans as to civil works, plumbing, electrical, mechanical, electronics, line and grade and sanitary.
2. Payment of Building Permit Fees and Zoning Clearance Fees at the Treasurer’s Office
2.1. Prepare and hand over all the assessment of corresponding fees and order of payments

Based on Building Code:
Fees Floor Area (sq.m) x 7.20
(Residential) Floor Area x 23.00
(Commercial) Electrical, Plumbing, Mechanical, Electronic and Fencing Fees.
2.1.1. Record the documents and prepare the Building Permit
2.1.2. Building Official signs the Building Permit
4. Fill-up Client Satisfaction Survey (CSS) form and drop it at feedback box.
4.1. Request Client to accomplish Client Satisfaction Survey form.
